column5: Hi all,  Nice new board.  Well i got back from my trip to the saugeen for a week. We caught some nice trout and lost so nice ones My biggest trout waz 12 pounds and i got my very frst trout there so my curse is over i can land trout. and i lost a big old lake trout  That waz my biggest trout it took me 500 yards down stream and 15min to reel him in what a tank.    There is a nice pic of the river.    There is my big one that is the same fish as in the first pic man that fish waz born eating bait fish    There is a nice one my friend caught    That waz my very first trout i have ever caught my first drift at Deeny`s Dam he took me way down stream we never usually fish there but i had to try a drift because there waz not many people there    And there waz some lunch And my campsite those were the fish we keep it waz my first fish so i had to take it home and the second one my friend caught she had fought herself to death    here is a close up of them nice fish a    hope u enjoy looking at the pics  Sorry for showing dead fish  p.s those are just some of the fish we caught  jordan
Dude thanks for the report!!! wicked!  How was the weather up there? I see you were camping? were you useing roe or artificial?  Cool!  Gerritt.
Nice trout, congrats on the first. Sounds like a great week on the river!  Mike
The weather waz great we had alot of rain on thrusday i waz using roe the hole time.    jordanwalsh
Looks like a great trip, nothing wrong with keeping a few for the campfire.
NICE JOB GUYS!!! BEAUTY LOOKIN WATERS
nice report and photos.  I give you credit for camping this time of year
I think my friend Ken actually met you guys up there! He was telling me about some hardcore young guys that were up to the Saugeen for a week, camping. lol  Nice report and great fish!
wow i would like to catch that first one holly
Nice job,  Some nice steelies fer sure... What amazes me bout your trip is that there were not manny people at dennys?  Man thats what I call great Luck!

ya first light there is no one there but after that it gets busy after my fish another guy moved in and caught one on his first drift it is good in early morning but after that don't go by 10 oclock the fish hav seen 100 roe bags and won't bite.    jordan
well done Jordan,  nice fish..... i must say the Saugeen is by far my fav. river to fish,    sounds like you enjoyed yourself...
very nice report and pics glad you got your first ever trout,you are hooked for life now
Nice report, congrats on your first steel   Great photos, were you fishing near Saugeen Shores or Walkerton? It is a great river to fish.  John
What a great report and beautiful fish.  Thanks for sharing.  Joey
Wow! Nice report and fish. Camping at this time of the year is pretty hardcore. At least you were rewarded for your efforts!  cheers,  ehg
Saugeen Shores we did not go past Deeny's Dam    jordan
